name: Card 0
action: Speculate about how libraries might serve one of these user groups by producing short narratives, sketches, and/or debates.

name: Card 1
action: Together or individually: Draw a map of a library that would serve one of the communities described in this map. What is included? How are materials organized?

name: Card 2
action: Individually, choose a country and develop an outline of needed resources and services, then compare each within the larger group. What is similar/different? How does a library adjust to the community and how can a library serve multiple communities well?

name: Card 3
action: What mechanisms are in place for listening to your users? What methods can we create that lean into the central ideas of their kingdoms to gather the best results?

name: Card 4
action: How might cultural habits change how your library is used? How might your library change cultural habits? What social norms, etiquette or traditions could change because of your library?

name: Card 5
action: Map out the differences and similarities that these community libraries would have. What can be learned from what they all share?
